sen.j: 世直し一揆（よなおしいっき）は、江戸時代後半から明治時代初期にかけて多発した一揆。
sen.e: Uprisings to reform society refers to the uprisings that frequently occurred in Japan from the later Edo period to the early Meiji period.
Yonaoshi Ikki refers to a rush of uprisings that the Japanese society experienced from the later Edo period to the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 打ちこわしや一揆そのものは生活苦の改善や新規の徴税や徴兵に反対するものが中心であり、思想的・政治的な背景に欠くもので、最終的には幕府・諸藩・明治政府のいずれかの兵に鎮圧されて終わった。
sen.e: Having no ideological and political background, most of the destructive riots and uprisings simply aimed at the relief from hardships of life, and demonstrated against the taxation and conscription imposed anew, so they ceased in the end when suppressed by Edo bakufu, local domains, or the Meiji government.

sen.e: But the main targets of the attack were the tax imposers until then (Edo bakufu and local domains), the people related to the authorities (village officers and chartered merchants), and the like, and as a result, the military action of Edo bakufu and local domains was hindered.
